page.title: 14CHILDREN'S GAMES,WITHERNSEA
page.content: In British Bulldog someone is chosen to be the catcher and stands in the middle of a rectangular area about the size of a tennis court.All the other children stand at one end and one is chosen by the catcher to try to run by him to the other end without being caught.If he is caught he joins the catcher and someone else is chosen.If he gets through all the others have to try to avoid those in the middle and get to the other end.Anyone caught joins the catchers.The game ends with all the children caught. In Stuck in the Mud one person is the catcher and the others have to be caught by being touched.They then stand still with their legs apart until freed by another player crawling under them.The catcher has to try to catch everyone and stop those already caught being freed.
